results.title: Promise in the sky
results.creator_credit: Bill Metcalfe, Judy Davison and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Uses special effects to show how the new generation of European and American satellites are being used to preserve life on earth. Includes glimpses of earth from outer space.

results.title: Hunters and collectors: the way to go out
results.creator_credit: Andrew de Groot, Julie Stone and Human Fraility
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of film clips and live tracks featuring the work of the band The Hunters and collectors. The filmclips comprise: “Talking to a stranger”, “Lumps of lead”, “Judas sheep”. Live traks include “The Way to go out”, “The Slab”, “Throw your arms around me”, “I couldnt give it to you”, “Chalkie”, “The Umbeliever”, “Carry me”, “I believe”.

results.title: Soldering
results.brief_description: Indicates that soldering plays a vital part in modern electronics and that it is esential to understand the art of soldering if becoming involved in this field. Provides the theory and demostrates the practical processes. No other credits available

results.title: Assembly tools
results.brief_description: Features the methods for mounting various types of components and demonstrates different methods of attaching leads through the board. Shows correct orientation of components and suggestions for handling sensitive components.

results.title: Fabrication
results.brief_description: Shows how to make circuit boards. The procedure for making a negative from master artwork is clearly outlined before the method for developing and etching a printed circuit board is covered.

results.title: Artwork design
results.brief_description: Shows how a rough sketch of a circuit proceeds through definite stages to master art work from which a circuit board can later be made.

results.title: Hit and miss
results.brief_description: Presents nine vignettes about conflict between young people and their parents. Each situation tends to be sympathetic to young people. Focuses on typically Anglo-saxon family situations.
